title: Hurricane Rafael plunges Cuba into another nationwide blackout
description: The storm has damaged the country’s already struggling electrical infrastructure, leading to widespread power outages.
author: Ruby Mellen, Samantha Schmidt
excerpt: The storm has damaged the country’s already struggling electrical infrastructure, leading to widespread power outages.
text: Hurricane Rafael blew through western Cuba on Wednesday night, flooding streets, damaging buildings and plunging millions of people into darkness.The country’s national power company said strong winds had caused the blackout. By Thursday, power in the central and eastern part of the country was restored, according to the office of the Cuban president. At least 2 million people remain without electricity in the west, including the capital, Havana.
html:
Hurricane Rafael blew through western Cuba on Wednesday night, flooding streets, damaging buildings and plunging millions of people into darkness.

The country’s national power company said strong winds had caused the blackout. By Thursday, power in the central and eastern part of the country was restored, according to the office of the Cuban president. At least 2 million people remain without electricity in the west, including the capital, Havana.
